pullRequest.body:
Any open covering of a profinite space can be refined to a covering by finitely many disjoint nonempty clopens.

---

### PR summary [5c63cbc2c1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21079/commits/5c63cbc2c1295974d671d2aff1ddabc70d2d962d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph

|Files|Import difference|

</details>

#### Declarations diff

`+ exists_finite_clopen_cover`
`+ exists_finite_nonempty_disjoint_clopen_cover`

`+ isOpen`
`+ toCloseds`

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21442~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Do we have/would it be worth defining what a cover is so that the statements don't need all the ands? I see `HasSeparatingCover` but no cover (unless I'm looking in the wrong place!). Although maybe this would need to be its own PR if its lots of work.

I don't think we have a definition of "cover" for topological spaces yet (unless there is something buried in the category / site theoretic stuff?). I fear it might be a bit of a can of worms; lots of people will have firmly held and mutually incompatible views as to what the formulation should be.
I've opened a conversation about this on Zulip [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Definition.20of.20a.20covering.20of.20a.20topological.20space.3F).
(marking this convo as resolved since #21442 is now merged and this PR rebased on top of it)
Can the latter be rephrased as being a cover somehow? Or should we only have a definition for `IsOpenCover` because that's what is needed 99%, and treat the rest in an ad-hoc way?

Hi Johan,

There are several options here. I could resuscitate the stuff I wrote with `LawfulTop` etc to allow defining covers by general `SetLike` types (e.g. `Clopens X`); but I'm not terribly keen on doing that, since I wrote all the code that way to start with, then spent significant effort re-writing it to get rid of the `LawfulXXX` stuff after it got a clear thumbs-down on Zulip. So being asked to go back to the original approach now would be quite frustrating. 

Alternatively, since clopens are a special case of opens, one could implement a clopen cover as a map `Î¹ â†’ Clopens X` with the property that the composition with the coercion `Clopens X â†’ Opens X` satisfies `IsOpenCover`. I would personally prefer this approach.

What do you think? I would appreciate some guidance on this before investing energy refactoring the code once again.

Best wishes, David

I think we should go ahead with the current design, but keep the other options in the back of our mind.
Another option, that doesn't involve `Lawful` stuff, is to use the set-theoretic union on the coerced-to-sets cover, instead of the lattice-theoretic sup on the not-yet-coerced-cover. I haven't thought through the implications though.
So let's just merge this now, and explore how it works in production.

bors merge

```suggestion
/-- A space is quasi-sober if it can be covered by open quasi-sober subsets. -/
```
Hi Johan! Thanks for looking at this, but the changes to `Sober.lean` in this PR here are directly inherited from the pre-requisite #21442, so maybe we should discuss them there.

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/Separation): coverings by disjoint clopens
